intro: Psychotria nagapatensis, commonly known as the Nagapatnam Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded forest undergrowth, where it thrives in humid and cool conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
